item.title: Quick journaling in org-mode in Emacs
item.description: A while back I started maintaining a journal, it can contain things that I’ve learned like new programming techniques, new commands, new insights, …etc. The key for me to make this viable is to be low-friction, so I’ve written an Emacs Lisp script that opens a journal in my journal directory with today’s date as the filename, so whenever I want to write something, I just hit Ctrl-x-j in emacs, write what i want and move on. And later on, if I want to check something in my journal e.g. an obscure command, I can just grep my journal directory.
